item.title: Cataclismo launches March 20
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/cataclismo-launches-march-20

  • PC

Real-time strategy and tower defense game currently in Early Access.

Real-time strategy and tower defense game Cataclismo will leave Early Access and launch for PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG on March 20, publisher Hooded Horse and developer Digital Sun announced.

Cataclismo first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam on July 22, 2024. Since launch, Digital Sun has released over a dozen updates, both major and minor, including new biomes, skirmish maps, a Sandbox mode, a veterancy system for units, and an overhaul of resource gathering.

The version 1.0 release will add the following content:

  • A new building piece that was previously available only to Kickstarter backers. It has a high cost and can teleport units in the same way the Citadel does.
  • The final form of the Survival game mode which comes with new roguelite mechanics and plenty of quality-of-life improvements from testing.
  • The Depths biome—a murky, new setting that will be available in Campaign, Survival, Skirmish, and the Level Editor. It also comes with a unique mechanic tied to darkness and light levels.
  • Opaline horrors. These pearlescent versions of horrors have never been exposed to light and, therefore, are more vicious and menacing than the other creatures of the Mist.
  • Six new missions to finish off the single-player campaign, most of which will be set in the Depths biome.
  • Another wave of improvements, balancing, tweaks, and bug fixes, all based on feedback from the early access period.
  • A makeover for Iris Renegate, the hero, including a new set of skills.

Watch a new trailer below.

Version 1.0 Release Date Trailer

item.title: Yooka-Replaylee ‘Rextro Bytes Back’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/yooka-replaylee-rextro-bytes-back-trailer

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Challenge new platforming puzzles across eight upgraded arcade machines.

Publisher Playtonic Friends and developer Playtonic Games have released a new trailer for Yooka-Replaylee showcasing the “Rextro Bytes Back” arcade game.

Players will be able to play as Rextro to challenge new platforming puzzles across eight upgraded arcade machines—defeating Megabyte enemies and collecting medals that can be exchanged for Pagies.

Yooka-Replaylee will be available for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below.

Rextro Bytes Back! Trailer

item.title: Famitsu Sales: 2/10/25 – 2/16/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/famitsu-sales-2-10-25-2-16-25

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Urban Myth Dissolution Center opens at 6,294 retail copies sold.

Famitsu has published its estimated physical game software data for Japan for the week of February 10, 2025 to February 16, 2025.

Urban Myth Dissolution Center was the highest selling new release, opening at 6,294 retail copies sold on Switch. The PlayStation 5 version did not chart in the top 10.

On the hardware side, the Switch family sold 40,003 units, the PlayStation 5 family sold 16,049 units, the Xbox Series family sold 2,826 units, and the PlayStation 4 family sold 23 units.

Get the full sales charts below.

Software Sales (followed by lifetime sales)

  1. [NSW] Donkey Kong Country Returns HD (Nintendo, 01/16/25) – 14,753 (195,449)
  2. [NSW] Super Mario Party Jamboree (Nintendo, 10/17/24) – 13,801 (1,189,073)
  3. [NSW] Mario Kart 8 Deluxe (Nintendo, 04/28/17) – 10,737 (6,248,684)
  4. [NSW] Urban Myth Dissolution Center (Shueisha Games, 02/13/25) – 6,294 (New)
  5. [NSW] Minecraft (Microsoft, 06/21/18) – 5,129 (3,811,294)
  6. [NSW] Animal Crossing: New Horizons (Nintendo, 03/20/20) – 5,050 (8,073,378)
  7. [NSW] Pokemon Scarlet / Pokemon Violet (The Pokemon Company, 11/18/22) – 3,782 (5,523,073)
  8. [NSW] Sid Meier’s Civilization VII (2K, 02/11/25) – 3,370 (3,370)
  9. [NSW] Super Smash Bros. Ultimate (Nintendo, 12/07/18) – 3,287 (5,720,077)
  10. [NSW] Super Mario Odyssey (Nintendo, 10/27/17) – 3,214 (2,550,165)

Rankings 11 to 30 will be announced on February 21.
